author: Rick Spilman
content: I am sure that you are right. There have been several references to “Navy ownership” in the press. They no doubt are references to the limited control the Navy has over the use and disposition of the sub.

author: Captain Mary
content: It is probably incorrect that the Navy still owns the submarine. If decommissioned and given to a museum, they do, however, still have a contractual say in how a museum disposes of their former vessel. The basis of this rule is to ensure that a museum does not allow a vessel to fall into the hands of an enemy foreign power for re-use. The museum is also not allowed to re-power and operate the vessel. It must be treated as a historical artifact. So, the Navy will need to approve the transfer to another museum. Sadly, the Navy does not provide any funding to its museum ships.
